intro: Tricalysia pedunculosa var. pilosula, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed tricalysia, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
